page.title: 10THE CODRINGTON ARMS
page.content: THE CODRINGTON ARMS. This is the only amenity in this area and the only public house for some miles. The house was once owned by the Codrington family of nearby Dodington who gave it its name.To-day the landlord rents it from Courages Brewery.Built in !720 of local stone the interior has low ceilings and wooden beams to support it.There is a large car park and facilities for children. Like most pubs in !985 its food trade is important and it has a lengthy menu of traditional pub and also foreign food. It attracts many customers from a large area, from Bristol, Yate and Kingswood.As a'local' it is a meeting place for old friends, for others an unspoilt,relaxed place in which to eat and drink.
